alert.note: Alert for Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 19 at 6:09PM EDT until August 19 at 8:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following county, Charleston. * WHEN...Until 800 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 606 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen along Highway 17 between Awendaw to McClellanville. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Water will likely fill or overflow the ditches along Highway 17. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McClellanville, Awendaw, Hampton Plantation State Park, Santee Coastal Reserve, Tibwin, Buck Hall, Germantown and South Santee.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
